entry.title: Dev tool api
entry.content:
Chrome Version : <from chrome://version/> OS : <OS version>
What steps will reproduce the problem?
What is the expected result?
What happens instead?
You can help us a lot by creating a minimal, reproducible example (https://stackoverflow.com/help/minimal-reproducible-example), e.g. on glitch.com, and/or attaching a screenshot or recording of the issue!

entry.title: Multiple 'interactive_ui_tests lacros version skew tests' fail due to a fatal test timeout crash
entry.content:
Individual interactive_ui_tests are not having a result in lacros skew testing.
I suspect that a fatal crashing test takes down the test task with the same tests never getting completion results.
We've been receiving some LUCI analysis bugs for various tests being flaky. Particularly have been looking at [AutofillInteractiveTest/AutofillInteractiveFencedFrameTest.SimpleCrossSiteFill/1](https://ci.chromium.org/ui/test/chromium/ninja%3A%2F%2Fchrome%2Ftest%3Ainteractive_ui_tests%2FAutofillInteractiveFencedFrameTest.SimpleCrossSiteFill%2FAutofillInteractiveTest.1?q=V%3Atest_suite%3Dinteractive_ui_tests%2520Lacros%2520version%2520skew%2520testing%2520ash%2520canary+) b/333628073 [AutofillInteractiveTest/AutofillInteractiveTestShadowDom.LabelInSameShadowDomAsField/0](https://ci.chromium.org/ui/test/chromium/ninja%3A%2F%2Fchrome%2Ftest%3Ainteractive_ui_tests%2FAutofillInteractiveTestShadowDom.LabelInSameShadowDomAsField%2FAutofillInteractiveTest.0?q=V%3Abuilder%3Dlinux-lacros-rel+V%3Aos%3DUbuntu-22.04+V%3Atest_suite%3Dinteractive_ui_tests%2520Lacros%2520version%2520skew%2520testing%2520ash%2520canary) b/333840465
These tests only appear to be flaky on linux-lacros-rel and particularly in the test suites that are doing "lacros version skew testing": 'interactive_ui_tests Lacros version skew testing ash beta' 'interactive_ui_tests Lacros version skew testing ash canary' 'interactive_ui_tests Lacros version skew testing ash dev' 'interactive_ui_tests Lacros version skew testing ash stable' This happens most often on 'canary' version.
However, when attempting to debug, the log shows that these tests log as an error always at 600-800 ms and always with the message "no test result for...". From an example task https://chromium-swarm.appspot.com/task?id=692012797e201010: ``` 2024-04-22T19:35:21.855433Z INFO interactive_ui_tests: [test_launcher.cc(1196)] Starting [AutofillInteractiveTest/AutofillInteractiveFencedFrameTest.SimpleCrossSiteFill/0] 2024-04-22T19:35:22.509118Z ERROR interactive_ui_tests: [test_launcher.cc(1294)] no test result for AutofillInteractiveTest/AutofillInteractiveFencedFrameTest.SimpleCrossSiteFill/0 [297/302] AutofillInteractiveTest/AutofillInteractiveFencedFrameTest.SimpleCrossSiteFill/0 (653 ms) 2024-04-22T19:35:22.509865Z INFO interactive_ui_tests: [test_launcher.cc(1196)] Starting [AutofillInteractiveTest/AutofillInteractiveFencedFrameTest.SimpleCrossSiteFill/1] 2024-04-22T19:35:23.163814Z ERROR interactive_ui_tests: [test_launcher.cc(1294)] no test result for AutofillInteractiveTest/AutofillInteractiveFencedFrameTest.SimpleCrossSiteFill/1 [298/302] AutofillInteractiveTest/AutofillInteractiveFencedFrameTest.SimpleCrossSiteFill/1 (653 ms) ```
When I look further, I see each instance has the same 20 tests fail (and then all fail on retry), all with the same message, all at about the same test execution time, and almost every time after the test [TabDragging/DetachToBrowserInSeparateDisplayTabDragControllerTest.DragMaxTabToNonMaxWindowInSeparateDisplay/1](https://ci.chromium.org/ui/test/chromium/ninja%3A%2F%2Fchrome%2Ftest%3Ainteractive_ui_tests%2FDetachToBrowserInSeparateDisplayTabDragControllerTest.DragMaxTabToNonMaxWindowInSeparateDisplay%2FTabDragging.1?q=V%3Abuilder%3Dlinux-lacros-rel+V%3Aos%3DUbuntu-22.04+V%3Atest_suite%3Dinteractive_ui_tests%2520Lacros%2520version%2520skew%2520testing%2520ash%2520canary) has crashed from a timed out run loop after around 1.7 minutes of execution time (when it passes it usually completes in 2-3 seconds). Here is a [Crash Log](https://chromium-swarm.appspot.com/task?id=692012797e201010#:~:text=chrome/browser/ui,0%20(81571%20ms))
I suspect that this fatal test crash is taking down the rest of these tests as collateral damage, so something the test runner may need to handle this better?
These are the tests that fail each time that I think are related: ``` AutofillInteractiveTest/AutofillInteractiveFencedFrameTest.SimpleCrossSiteFill/0 b/333628073 AutofillInteractiveTest/AutofillInteractiveFencedFrameTest.SimpleCrossSiteFill/1 b/333628073 AutofillInteractiveTest/AutofillInteractiveTestShadowDom.LabelInSameShadowDomAsField/0 b/333840465 TabDragging/DetachToBrowserInSeparateDisplayTabDragControllerTest.DragMaxTabToNonMaxWindowInSeparateDisplay/1 b/332856978, b/332927776 MediaRouterIntegrationBrowserTest.Fail_SendMessage/Cast b/333844360 MediaRouterIntegrationBrowserTest.SendAndOnMessage/Cast b/333811373 MediaRouterIntegrationOneUANoReceiverBrowserTest.ReconnectSessionSameTab/Cast b/333842241 All/PDFExtensionInteractiveUITest.FocusForwardTraversal/0 b/332936958 All/PDFExtensionInteractiveUITest.TouchSelectionBounds/0 b/333839976 ProfilePickerParametrizedInteractiveUiTest.ContinueWithoutAccount/WithSearchEngineChoiceStep b/333809828 All/TabHoverCardFadeFooterInteractiveUiTest.BackgroundTabHoverCardContentsHaveCorrectDimensions/0 b/333776707 All/TabHoverCardFadeFooterInteractiveUiTest.FooterHidesOnTabWithoutMemoryUsage/0 b/332930513 All/TabHoverCardFadeFooterInteractiveUiTest.HoverCardFooterMemoryUsagePrefDisabled/1 b/332938498 All/TabHoverCardInteractiveUiTest.HoverCardHidesOnMouseExit/0 b/333776707 All/TabHoverCardInteractiveUiTest.HoverCardShownOnTabFocus/0 b/333776707 All/TabHoverCardInteractiveUiTest.InactiveWindowStaysInactiveOnHover/0 b/333776707 All/TabHoverCardInteractiveUiTest.WidgetNotVisibleOnMousePressAfterTabFocus/1 b/333776707 All/TabHoverCardInteractiveUiTest.WidgetVisibleOnKeyPressAfterTabFocus/1 b/333776707 All/TranslateBubbleViewUITest.ClickPageNotInSourceLanguage/MultipleBubble b/332793355 All/TranslateBubbleViewUITest.NetworkInterruption/Incognito b/333794768 ```

entry.title: SerialPort.open hangs intermittently
entry.content:
Repro steps: 1. Pair a bluetooth device with an M1 Macbook 2. Call Serial.requestPort() 3. Select device 4. Invoke open() on the port returned by step #2
Expected: Promise resolves or rejects
Actual: Promise hangs. Subsequent invocations of SerialPort.open result in an error
For more details and logs see: b/327064215

entry.title: Informe de error
entry.content:
This template is for filing bugs against Android System WebView. Chrome bugs should be filed at https://crbug.com/wizard.
Android device name:
Android OS version:
Android System WebView version: (Settings > Apps > the 3 dots in the upper right > Show system. On Android N (7.x) through P (9.0), please include Chrome's version. Otherwise, look for "Android System WebView")
Application: (package name or Play Store URL)
Application version:
Steps to reproduce:
1. 2. 3.
Expected result:
Actual result:
Did this work before? (last working WebView version, or N/A)
---
It's especially helpful if you can capture a bug report right after you experience the bug, and attach it here. See https://developer.android.com/studio/debug/bug-report for instructions.
Screen recordings can also be very helpful - see https://developer.android.com/studio/command-line/adb#screenrecord. Please enable "Show taps" in developer settings.

entry.title: Autofill latency optimization: Metrics implementations
entry.content: For tracking metrics addition to monitor latency optimization. Design: go/pay-autofill-chrome-risk-data-latency-explorations-and-optimization

entry.title: Credential manager dialog has no opt-out or backoff
entry.content: When visiting a site like Instagram where the user has a stored password Chrome displays a "Sign in as" prompt. Unlike other permissions, this prompt is modal and offers no option to deny the site the ability to ask again. Visiting the same site in another tab allows it to display the prompt again even if the user has just dismissed it, indicating there's no backoff implemented.

entry.title: Nested subgrids row heights aren't recalculating on hydration. Seems to be a new regression.
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. Use chrome 124.0.6367.61 2. Create a grid, with subgrid enabled children 3. Inject items into the dom within the subgrid wrapper 4. The height of the grid rows do not recalculate
# Problem Description Injected items into the grid/subgrid on chrome 124.0.6367.61 aren't triggering a recalculation in the grid.
Reproducible here: https://codesandbox.io/p/sandbox/nested-subgrid-bug-999dgd?file=%2Fsrc%2FPost.tsx%3A56%2C17 https://uploads.codesandbox.io/uploads/user/64aa665c-104f-4b4e-926f-0a87ef2dc275/PiBQ-chrome-124--with-regression.gif
This appears to be a new regression, I have a recording of a how this is working as expected in a previous version of chrome (123.0.6312.106). https://uploads.codesandbox.io/uploads/user/64aa665c-104f-4b4e-926f-0a87ef2dc275/A4GT-chrome-123.gif
# Summary Nested subgrids row heights aren't recalculating on hydration. Seems to be a new regression.
# Custom Questions #### Which component does this fall under? Blink>Layout
#### Does this work in other browsers? Yes - This is just a Chrome problem
# Additional Data Category: API \ Chrome Channel: Stable \ Regression: Yes

entry.title: [Topics] Add metrics that isolates the calculation result by the retrying number
entry.content: Add metrics that provide granular visibility into calculation results at each retry step.

entry.title: Enabling Verve and it's assets for Chrome
entry.content: This bug is to track the progress made for enabling Verve as a supported type for Autofill (Upstream, Downstream and Sync) on Chromium.

entry.title: Investigate not installing some Dispatchers if rules are not set
entry.content: Sandbox IPC functions are setup even if no rules exist for them. Those that call QueryBroker will not be sent to the broker, and denied at the broker. Perhaps they could simply not be registered during process startup.

entry.title: Null-dereference READ in blink::ThirdPartyScriptDetector* blink::Supplementable<blink::LocalDOMWindow>::R
entry.content:
Detailed Report: https://clusterfuzz.com/testcase?key=6238741812150272
Fuzzer: puzzor_svg Job Type: linux_ubsan_chrome Platform Id: linux
Crash Type: Null-dereference READ Crash Address: 0x0000000001e8 Crash State: blink::ThirdPartyScriptDetector* blink::Supplementable<blink::LocalDOMWindow>::R blink::ThirdPartyScriptDetector::From blink::AnimationFrameTimingMonitor::RecordLongAnimationFrameUKMAndTrace
Sanitizer: undefined (UBSAN)
Regressed: https://clusterfuzz.com/revisions?job=linux_ubsan_chrome&range=1290685:1290718
Reproducer Testcase: https://clusterfuzz.com/download?testcase_id=6238741812150272
Issue filed automatically.
To reproduce this, please build the target in this report and run it against the reproducer testcase. Please use the GN arguments provided at bottom of this report when building the binary.
If you have trouble reproducing, please also export the environment variables listed under "[Environment]" in the crash stacktrace.
If you have any feedback on reproducing test cases, let us know at https://forms.gle/Yh3qCYFveHj6E5jz5 so we can improve.

entry.title: Key commitment "id" >INT32_MAX not supported by parser
createNetwork don't fail when a matching configured network already exists
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. configure a new network 2. using createNetwork to call the guid again 3. no showing expected fail, but it used to be
# Problem Description We are using chrome.networking.onc to develop a wifi switch function, we use createNetwork and it used to show error when it is being called with the already configure network last year, but when we try to update the feature recently, we find that no matter this network is configured or not, it should return a new guid and never fail. We want to know if this function is being updated as the website still show it suppose to fail. Or there is some issue with this function.
# Additional Comments we test it in a chrome tablet.
# Summary createNetwork don't fail when a matching configured network already exists
# Custom Questions #### Which component does this fall under? Blink>Network
#### Does this work in other browsers? Not sure - I don't know
# Additional Data Category: API \ Chrome Channel: Not sure \ Regression: N/A

entry.title: [reading-order-items] Improve performance when looping Focus Scope Owner's Descendants
entry.content:
In FocusNavigation::NextReadingOrderItem, the call to ElementTraversal::DescendantsOf is executed for each next_in_dom_order element we are trying to map to its next_in_reading_order equivalent.
> You're going to run into performance problems with this, since you'll do this O(n) tree walk for each flex item, and there could be O(n) flex items that don't have focusable children. So this could be O(n^2). Maybe ok to land for now, but certainly worth a bug and comment here that we should make it better. Likely the easy fix is to just run this descendant walk only once in the constructor, and store the ordered list there.
Consider improving the performance by storing the generated list of elements as a Member.
[1] https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5431133/comment/2d2ae1ec_044d4ae4/

entry.title: Roll unrar to 7.0.7
entry.content: Unrar has [released](https://www.rarlab.com/rar_add.htm) version 7.0.7, so we should update the copy in Chromium following the [documentation](https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/unrar/README.md)

entry.title: [reading-order-items] content-visibility cases
entry.content:
From CL review: > Somewhere here there's a content-visibility bug. I think you might need to check whether you're inside a content visibility hidden subtree. None of that content will have layout objects, and this code will get confused.
We need to test for `content-visibility` when inside a slot that has no parent layout object.
[1] https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5431133/comment/05f97b83_bc84a500/

entry.title: [Compose] iron-icons are missing from the dialog
entry.content: We use standalone iron-icon elements in some places of the dialog, like the FRE, and in action buttons for Submit and Go back from error. Recently added editable results also adds these elements for use in the new undo and redo buttons. This change https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5449939 caused iron-icons in the compose dialog to no longer be rendered. This is because the compose app was previously relying on transitive dependencies to use iron-icon instead of directly importing it, and those dependencies were broken.

entry.title: Chrome Camera permissions- Camera is not displayed on Linux desktop - https://b.corp.google.com/issues/336355563
BrowserProcess incorrectly tries to create NotificationUIManager during shutdown
entry.content: When the browser shuts down, BrowserProcess tries to call Shutdown() on the NotificationUIManager. If that object was never created, it tries to create it first, and this results in a crash. A simple solution is to check for shutdown before creating the object.

entry.title: [Blink Bindings Perf Regressions]: 2 regressions in blink_perf.bindings
entry.content:

entry.title: 3 CSPP pings per day cap isn't being respected
entry.content:
The limit for ESB users is set [here](https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:components/safe_browsing/core/common/features.cc;drc=aac75e1d42c143ae268bd6adfdec9191f2cc1c33;l=324) and checked [here](https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:components/safe_browsing/content/browser/client_side_detection_service.cc;drc=aac75e1d42c143ae268bd6adfdec9191f2cc1c33;l=430) and triggered from [here](https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:components/safe_browsing/content/browser/client_side_detection_host.cc;drc=aac75e1d42c143ae268bd6adfdec9191f2cc1c33;l=393).
Reviewing where the trigger for the check happens, in order for the check to actually happen, there is the following condition:
`!csd_service_->IsInCache(url_)`
That is, the URL shouldn't be in the cache.
In the cases, where notification permission prompt triggers the ping, the cache is skipped. And since, the permission prompt will usually come after the page fully loads and CSPP runs the first time, the above condition is likely to return false -- in which case, the over-the-limit check will be skipped.
### Task
1. Verify that the above diagnosis is correct. 2. If (1) holds, update condition to ignore the cache check in the event the trigger was a permission prompt.

entry.title: Support multiple providers in navigator.identity.get() request
entry.content: Support multiple providers in navigator.identity.get() request

entry.title: Reevaluate security
entry.content:
Before we can ship, we need to address any outstanding security questions. Specifically:
1. Either move Autofill to an isolated world, or consult security on the possibility of enabling x-frame filling in the page world. Our initial security analysis was based on the assumption that the move to an isolated world would happen before this project completed.
2. Reread the relevant section of the design doc and verify that all of the necessary security mitigations were implemented. In particular, I know I discussed potentially extracting some policies that pages can set in attributes and passing that information back to the core components code, and I know I haven't implemented that, but IIRC it was a nice-to-have.
3. Document any deviations from the approved doc that happened during the course of implementation.

entry.title: Chrome Camera permissions- Camera is not displayed on Linux desktop - https://b.corp.google.com/issues/336345234
RHS location bar indicator pops-up while in the "site-ask OS-block" flow as soon as the user grants site-level permission, which clashes with OS PEPC screen
Use modal views API as requested by views team
Add concept of focused Facility and modify checkActivePreconditions() to check only the focused facility
Deprecate v8::Object::SetAccessor() and v8::ObjectTemplate::SetAccessor().
entry.content:
V8 Api has `v8::Object::SetAccessor()` and `v8::ObjectTemplate::SetAccessor()` which allow defining writable properties without providing a setter. Setting to such a "malicious read-only" property works as a no-op which violates JavaScript spec (writing to a writable data property can't fail and should end up updating the value, see https://tc39.es/ecma262/#sec-validateandapplypropertydescriptor).
"Malicious read-only" properties defined by `SetAccessor()` Api should be fixed by one of the following approaches:
1) Define it as a true read-only JavaScript property (using `v8::ReadOnly` attribute). This will behave the same except that in strict mode attempts to write to such a property will throw `TypeError: Cannot assign to read only property 'x' of object 'obj'`.
2) Use `SetLazyDataProperty()` which will define it in such a way that the property will be replaced with an ordinary writable data property after first read. Subsequent reads will no longer trigger the getter callback and subsequent writes will update the data property.
3) Define it as a JavaScript accessor property using `SetAccessorProperty()` and providing `v8::FunctionTemplate` or `v8::Function` as getter/setter callbacks.
Note that using `SetNativeDataProperty()` with a no-op setter callback is a **bad** option since it would still violate semantics of the JavaScript `[[Set]]` [operation](https://tc39.es/ecma262/#sec-ordinary-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots-set-p-v-receiver) for data properties which is supposed to be just a write of a new value.
---
Eventually, V8 will prohibit data property getter/setter callbacks to produce observable side effects such as throwing exceptions or executing JavaScript code.
This will make the V8 Api closer to the JavaScript spec and make the V8 code cleaner.
---
Currently, [the following components](https://source.chromium.org/search?q=file:%28renderer%7Cgin%29%20%22SetAccessor%28%22%20case:yes&ss=chromium%2Fchromium%2Fsrc) in Chromium still use the old Api:
1) [extensions/renderer/bindings/api_last_error.cc](https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:extensions/renderer/bindings/api_last_error.cc?q=file:%28renderer%7Cgin%29%20%22SetAccessor%28%22%20case:yes&ss=chromium%2Fchromium%2Fsrc)
2) [chrome/renderer/loadtimes_extension_bindings.cc](https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/renderer/loadtimes_extension_bindings.cc?q=file:%28renderer%7Cgin%29%20%22SetAccessor%28%22%20case:yes&ss=chromium%2Fchromium%2Fsrc)
3) [third_party/blink/renderer/bindings/core/v8/local_window_proxy.cc](https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/blink/renderer/bindings/core/v8/local_window_proxy.cc?q=file:%28renderer%7Cgin%29%20%22SetAccessor%28%22%20case:yes&ss=chromium%2Fchromium%2Fsrc)
4) [third_party/blink/renderer/bindings/core/v8/v8_throw_dom_exception.cc](https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/blink/renderer/bindings/core/v8/v8_throw_dom_exception.cc?q=file:%28renderer%7Cgin%29%20%22SetAccessor%28%22%20case:yes&ss=chromium%2Fchromium%2Fsrc)
5) [third_party/blink/renderer/bindings/core/v8/v8_page_popup_controller_binding.cc](https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/blink/renderer/bindings/core/v8/v8_page_popup_controller_binding.cc?q=file:%28renderer%7Cgin%29%20%22SetAccessor%28%22%20case:yes&ss=chromium%2Fchromium%2Fsrc)
6) [extensions/renderer/module_system.cc](https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:extensions/renderer/module_system.cc?q=file:%28renderer%7Cgin%29%20%22SetAccessor%28%22%20case:yes&ss=chromium%2Fchromium%2Fsrc)
7) [extensions/renderer/api/runtime_hooks_delegate.cc](https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:extensions/renderer/api/runtime_hooks_delegate.cc?q=file:%28renderer%7Cgin%29%20%22SetAccessor%28%22%20case:yes&ss=chromium%2Fchromium%2Fsrc)
8) [chrome/renderer/extensions/api/app_hooks_delegate.cc](https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/renderer/extensions/api/app_hooks_delegate.cc?q=file:%28renderer%7Cgin%29%20%22SetAccessor%28%22%20case:yes&ss=chromium%2Fchromium%2Fsrc)
9) [chrome/renderer/extensions/api/extension_hooks_delegate.cc](https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/renderer/extensions/api/extension_hooks_delegate.cc?q=file:%28renderer%7Cgin%29%20%22SetAccessor%28%22%20case:yes&ss=chromium%2Fchromium%2Fsrc)
10) [third_party/pdfium/fxjs/cfxjs_engine.cpp](https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/pdfium/fxjs/cfxjs_engine.cpp?q=file:%28renderer%7Cgin%29%20%22SetAccessor%28%22%20case:yes&ss=chromium%2Fchromium%2Fsrc)

entry.title: Implement functions for SCOPED_UMA_HISTOGRAM_TIMER & SCOPED_UMA_HISTOGRAM_THREAD_TIMER
entry.content:
Implement functions for SCOPED_UMA_HISTOGRAM_TIMER & SCOPED_UMA_HISTOGRAM_THREAD_TIMER. These will replace macro usage in components/subresource_filter so that different filters can log metrics at the same callsite.
Sample usage that needs replacing: https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:components/subresource_filter/content/shared/browser/ruleset_service.cc;drc=5407e6205d9a54ce49175771c80fcab7b2498b5e;l=345
Context CL: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5462941
Please see the discussion in uma-users: https://groups.google.com/a/google.com/g/uma-users/c/VMSMT_UtpG8
Macros file: https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:base/metrics/histogram_macros.h;drc=a0782e8a696dc65f1bf525c5ded9df265eb3cd36;l=297
Functions file: https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:base/metrics/histogram_functions.h
This is blocking for using the fingerprinting_protection filter because it would otherwise pollute subresource_filter metrics.

entry.title: Link new internal repository to internal directory in c/b/resources/downloads
entry.content: After creating a new internal repository found here: https://chrome-internal.googlesource.com/chrome/browser/resources/downloads_internal/ we need to link it to a directory in chrome/browser/resources/downloads/ so that we can place our internal gshield icon and reference it in c/b/r/downloads/item.html.
